title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry in the early 19th century.
A dystopian social science fiction story that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and pervasive government surveillance.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Set in a small Southern town during the Great Depression, this novel tackles racial injustice and the moral growth of its young narrator.

title: Moby Dick
description: A sprawling maritime adventure that follows the obsessed Captain Ahab's pursuit of a legendary white whale.

title: The Great Gatsby
description: A portrait of the Roaring Twenties that examines themes of wealth, love, and the elusive American Dream.

title: Fahrenheit 451
description: A cautionary tale about a future society where books are outlawed and firemen burn any they find.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The first part of a sweeping epic in which a band of heroes sets out to destroy an ancient and powerful ring.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: A comedic science fiction novel that follows an unwitting human's intergalactic adventure after Earth's destruction.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and begins his first year at a magical school, uncovering hidden secrets.

title: War and Peace
description: A vast historical novel intertwining the lives of Russian aristocrats with the Napoleonic Wars of the early 19th century.
